metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41674 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.19.16. Attackers able to inject WLAN frames could cause a buffer overflow in the ieee80211_bss_info_update function in net/mac80211/scan.c. Sönke Huster discovered that an integer overflow vulnerability existed in the WiFi driver stack in the Linux kernel, leading to a buffer overflow. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> it was claimed by the reporter that with the fix for this CVE applied, an slab-out-of-bounds issue might raise and, as it is not harmful, there is no additional CVE for it, but the fix for this followup issue is commit 567e14e3.

criterions.comment: backport-iwlwifi-dkms package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-23.24').
linux-aws package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.

linux-gcp package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
